    Examine a graph's connectivity
    Author:

    • Method Detail

      • findIsolatedElements

        public static <G extends IGraph<G,?,N>,N extends INode<G,?,N>> java.util.Set<N> findIsolatedElements(G graph)
        Compute all isolated elements of a graph. A node is isolated if it has no edges.
        Type Parameters:
        G - The type of the graph that is examine.
        N - The type of the graph's nodes.
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph whose weak connectivity should be checked.
        Returns:
        All isolated elements of the graph.

      • isWeaklyConnected

        public static <G extends IGraph<G,?,N>,N extends INode<G,?,N>> boolean isWeaklyConnected(G graph)
        Check if a graph is weakly connected. A graph is weakly connected if it has just a single weakly connected component.
        Type Parameters:
        G - The type of the graph that is examine.
        N - The type of the graph's nodes.
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph whose weak connectivity should be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the graph is weakly connected.

      • getWeaklyConnectedComponents

        public static <G extends IGraph<G,?,N>,N extends INode<G,?,N>> java.util.Set<? extends java.util.Set<N>> getWeaklyConnectedComponents(G graph)
        Compute all of a graph's weakly connected components. The weakly connected component of a node is the set of nodes that are reachable from it while ignoring the direction of edges. All weakly connected components form a partition of the graph's nodes.
        Type Parameters:
        G - The type of the graph that is examine.
        N - The type of the graph's nodes.
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph whose strong connectivity should be checked.
        Returns:
        A partition of the graph's nodes into components.

      • getWeaklyConnectedComponent

        public static <N extends INode<?,?,N>> java.util.Set<N> getWeaklyConnectedComponent(N node)
        Get the weakly connected component of a given node.
        Type Parameters:
        N - The type of the graph's nodes.
        Parameters:
        node - The node whose component should be calculated.
        Returns:
        The node's component.

      • isStronglyConnected

        public static <G extends IGraph<G,?,N>,N extends INode<G,?,N>> boolean isStronglyConnected(G graph)
        Check if a graph is strongly connected. A graph is strongly connected if it just has a single strongly connected component.
        Type Parameters:
        G - The type of the graph that is examine.
        N - The type of the graph's nodes.
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph whose strong connectivity should be checked.
        Returns:
        true if the graph is strongly connected.

      • getStronglyConnectedComponents

        public static <G extends IGraph<G,?,N>,N extends INode<G,?,N>> java.util.Set<? extends java.util.Set<N>> getStronglyConnectedComponents(G graph)
        Compute all of a graph's strongly connected components. The strongly connected component of a node is the set of nodes that are reachable from it while just following edges forwards ("in the direction of the arrow"). All strongly connected components form a partition of the graph's nodes.
        Type Parameters:
        G - The type of the graph that is examine.
        N - The type of the graph's nodes.
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph that should be examined.
        Returns:
        A partition of the graph's nodes into components.
